thread.title: Mexican man pleads guilty to growing marijuana in Sequoia
thread.title_full: Mexican man pleads guilty to growing marijuana in Sequoia - The Denver Post

author: The Associated Press
title: Mexican man pleads guilty to growing marijuana in Sequoia
text:
FRESNO, Calif. (AP) — A Mexican national has pleaded guilty to cultivating marijuana in connection with a large-scale operation in the Brush Creek drainage in California's Sequoia National Forest.
The Fresno Bee reports (http://bit.ly/1MRAC9b ) that 49-year-old Ezequiel Armas-Ortiz of Michoacan, Mexico, pleaded guilty Monday. Court documents say Armas-Ortiz and two other men were responsible for watering 2,719 marijuana plants at the site.
Armas-Ortiz agreed to make restitution to the U.S. Forest Service for extensive damage caused by the marijuana growth.
He could be sentenced to as many as 20 years in prison and charged a $1 million fine. Armas-Ortiz could also be deported to Mexico after serving time.
His sentencing hearing is in January.
———
Information from: The Fresno Bee, http://www.fresnobee.com
